title: Nobody takes you serious Riot

embed.description: Imgur: The magic of the Internet

body:
This company riot is beyond belief the shittiest company. I've never seen anything like it. To the extent of why you are trash by no means can be put into 1 picture, but here is just one picture of it. This will also be most likely censored and taken down because you hate facing facts. Just another reason your company is absolute garbage. Not a single other company would do this, and if they are actual businesses not online, they aren't even allowed to, because they have a government keeping them from being a piece of shit that your company has turned into.

Precursor,
I've never been chat restricted, I've never been banned, I know for a fact that this is nothing but abuse.

Earlier today I was playing the game where all 4 players on my team were harassing me from the start. Their only intention was to troll me. My support was csing my lane. My entire team was purposely and intentionally just trying to attack me, verbally, and in game. BUT LUCKY FOR ME I HAVE RIOT RIGHT?? If I was a piece of shit trying to specifically to ruin their experience, then yep, Riot would be on my side.

The best part about this is that they have literally no reason for my 14 day ban.

This is why nobody take's Riot serious. This is why, their game will and continue to be the worst community of all time. This is why anything dealing with e-sports has been given a bad rep. This is why I never support any major function for anything dealing with riot, because they do not put the player first and never intend to. And I don't think I've ever talked to anyone that hasn't said "Before I was banned" EXCEPT the worst fucking people I've ever seen online at all. ESPECIALLY forum trolls in the player behavior forums. They just still think their system is flawless somehow. These people are legit nut jobs. How can you seriously think your system works AT ALL? Absolutely terrible company. Somebody in their management needs to wake up and actually do something about this, because all that's going to happen is these low life riot workers are just going to assert their power around like they already do and oppress anyone with an opinion against them.

And here you are completely wrong.

In the ToU, with which every single one of us agreed in order to play league, it says that RIOT has total authority when it comes to the game. If they dont want someone to play the game, either because he broke the ToU or they have a reason that they dont want to reveal, they can ban you and you can do nothing about it. Also, the account you play with, along with everyone else's account, is not yours, per se, its RIOT's property. They have simply given you permission to use it. So they have complete authority over it. And, unless they permanently banned a specific person, what was banned is the account, not you. Also, regarding the "massive" amount of money you have "given" them. You dont actually buy their product. You pay for the ability to use digital contact, you dont own the skins or whatever you bought, you just payed for the ability to use them. And, as a digital content, the one who actually owns the rights for it can forbid you from using them at any time. They dont actually steal from you.

But, honestly, do you really think a company that makes millions would really care about a random person's $500? What is a lot of money for you, its close to nothing for them. You should understand, though i doubt it, that they have complete authority over their game and you can do absolutely nothing to them, law wont even be on your side. You see, contracts between individuals, parties or companies are above the law. So, even if they were actually stealing from you by banning you, since you agreed to that when signing their contract, even the law can do anything for you.
Pyramid schemes are illegal, even though people are willing to participate in them, how does that work?

Because pyramid schemes work by making people believe they can get profits that are in reality not even obtainable in the slightest. Trying to sell a pyramid scheme can only be successful if you are explicitely lying or lying by omission, which ultimately makes it a form of fraud.

Riot on the other hand isn't trying to mislead anybody. They make those things extremely clear in their ToS and anybody that reads it (which you promise to have done when you accept the terms) knows without any question about the exact status of their account and other digital goods bound to that account.
It's also the only way to do this because you need their server for your account (and skins on it) to even have any meaning. And they simply have the right to choose who is allowed to access said server and who is not. That leaves two options: Either you don't own the things you paid for (which is admittedly a bit weird) or you don't own the things that you rented.

Whichever of these two models you prefer, at the end of the day "your" account is not an actual object but merely an agreed upon way of accessing Riot's server. That's nothing you can own; and consequently it's nothing Riot can steal.

I don't know 100% how things would work out in court if anybody ever decided to sue a company for banning them (especially if the reason was bogus), but you simply cannot compare this at all to pyramid schemes.

Doesn't League of Legends ( Riot ) work because they make people believe they can buy stuff online, also believe some day you can make it into a tournament where you have a chance to play against the best for a huge pot of money, and also believe you own your vary own account with crypto currency that allows you to purchase skins and other things, when in reality you pay money for something that isn't obtainable in the slightest?

Knowing full well most everyone doesn't sit there and read or care about the ToU/ ToS.

Are you then saying that League of Legends is lying by granting themselves special powers to do whatever they want to whomever they want for any reason at any time because its their game and it doesn't matter if people pay anything? 

When I hit the " PURCHASE" button, that doesn't tell me I am renting anything, it tells me I am buying something. If Riot isn't telling me up front that I am paying money to Rent the game, or Rent the stuff in the game, then they have a real problem on their hands if someone starts paying close attention. 

{{sticker:vlad-salute}}

It pretty much says in the ToS that you're not buying a product, and that it's yours. It says you have purchased the right to use that product. I know everyone skips the ToS, but by skipping it, you still agree to it.

You have to agree to it to play, so its not really an agreement negotiated, its forced upon all people who want to play. 
ToS isn't legal, its just documentation and its Civil if anything.

But you know what isn't required to play? Buying rp and using it. If you want to use the "Have to accept to play" argument then consider this example. For some rides or contests, you have to sign an agreement/waiver to release liability should you get hurt.

Doesn't matter. The law protects consumers from bad business practices, thats why you don't see Riot randomly shutting down accounts with major invested money for no reason. 
They legally could just start banning accounts based on the stupid ToS that you think is actual law. It doesn't matter, its just a CYA for Riot, and isn't worth the paper they wrote it on.

Boy oh boy. Just wait until you read Steam's ToU.

Valveâ€™s updated Steam agreement bars class action lawsuit, and it is legal.

Whats your point? Baring class action lawsuits is legal, means everything in the ToU is legal?

https://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/usury

It does mean that everything is enforceable by the law, so... Yeah, pretty damn legal.

Usury is a pointless term to use in this case since there is no lending of money or interest rate?
If you used it because you don't own the virtual goods, still wrong since you are basically renting for an indefinite time.

People with over thousands of dollars invested have had accounts banned for breaking rules. People who have maybe 20 dollars invested have been banned for breaking rules. People who haven't spent a dime have been banned for breaking rules. People who have invested the same amount have also not been banned because they don't break the rules. So to bring it back to an original discussion, they aren't terminating accounts for no reason. If one happens to be banned in error, they correct it.

The concept of  _usury_  proves that contracts cannot supersede what a law says. 
Don't pretend you think I am equating these terms of use to usury.

> [{quoted}](name=DBS Ronovon,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=aVnL5q60,comment-id=000a0002000000000000000200000002000000000000000000000003,timestamp=2018-01-19T09:23:10.211+0000)
>
> So I don't get a product? Why do you say I am getting something? 
> If I am getting something, that thing is called a product. 
> The lease on the apartment? When I "rented" the skins I paid for, how long is the lease term?
> If the lease has no end, then I bought the right to use it forever, and revoking that right to use it would be stealing money.

The "lease" (closer to a license, actually) on using the skin on that one account technically is permanent. Your access to the account that you never actually paid for and that is still Riot's, however, is not. And given that you are only allowed to use the account as long as you abide by Riot's terms of use, you are shit out of luck if you don't and lose your access to the account which never was yours and which was explicitely **said** to not be yours.

Let's say a friend allows you to live in an appartment for free but discloses certain rules you need to follow for as long as you live there.
You acknowledge and agree to the rules.
Because he's also good with paint and you like the color green, you give him money so he can paint **his** appartment green.
You then proceed to break the rules and he subsequently kicks you out.

Do you think that in this scenario you would have any way of getting back the money you paid for having the room painted?

> [{quoted}](name=DBS Ronovon,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=aVnL5q60,comment-id=000a0002000000000000000200000002000000000000000000000001,timestamp=2018-01-19T08:29:58.611+0000)
>
> When you pay money for a product

You don't. That's the point that the ToS clarifies. You can't purchase one thing and then get upset about not getting the thing you thought you were purchasing.

What you are doing is the equivalent of buying a ticket for the cinema and then get upset that you didn't get the DVD of the movie.

>if the ToS say you don't actually get anything for the money you spend, that is stealing, which is illegal.

You are getting something. You just don't get any ownership over anything. Just like with millions of other real life examples. Or do you legally own your gardener just because you pay him? What about the aforementioned cinema ticket? What about renting an appartment?
Are all of these "stealing"?

It's called a contract and you signed it, by hitting accept. By hitting accept, you've accepted all the terms that come with hitting accept. By playing the game, you've agreed to all the terms that were set in ToS, to which you hit accept. 

In the eyes of a court, that's as legal as it gets.
